intro: Tauschia sandwithiana, commonly known as the sandwithian sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens, typical of the family. Tauschia sandwithiana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
